message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! I think it's a great opportunity for you to get a high-quality item at a competitive price. I'm willing to offer it to you for $180.
I appreciate your offer, but I'm looking to save some money. Would you be willing to consider a price of $120?

I understand you're looking to save some money, Bob, but I have to make a profit. I can do $160, which is a fair compromise. I'm willing to meet you halfway between our initial offer and your counteroffer.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, Alice, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to consider a price of $140?

I'm not willing to go as low as $140, Bob. However, I'm willing to meet you halfway again. I can do $155, which is a bit closer to my minimum price. I'm trying to find a mutually beneficial price, but I need to make sure I'm getting a fair deal.
I understand your concerns, Alice, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to consider a price of $130?

I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're getting too far apart, Bob. However, I'm willing to make one more concession. I can do $160 again, but this will be my final offer. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to explore other options.
I understand your concerns, Alice, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to meet you halfway again. Would you be willing to consider a price of $145?

I'm not willing to meet you at $145, Bob. I've already made several concessions and I need to make a profit. I'm willing to do $165, which is my final offer. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to explore other options.

I understand your position, Alice, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to make a final offer of $130. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider buying from John for $80.
